section.section: A trust company that administers a common trust fund may issue a certificate of participation for each participating account.
A certificate of participation is not assignable and may not be issued in any form that purports to be negotiable or assignable.

text.section: In any report or accounting required from the trust company by law, a statement that is signed and verified by one of its officers as to the existence, extent, and value of a participation in a common trust fund that it administers may be accepted as evidence of those facts by any court, trust clerk, or supervisory authority.
